name: Spicy Vegan Tortilla Soup
description: This spicy vegan tortilla soup, is not your typical tex-mex, cumin and chili powder seasoned soup. The broth for this soup is simmered with epazote, chile morita, tomato, onion, garlic, and chipotle, then garnished with fried or baked tortilla strips, baked tofu, crispy chile ancho, and avocado.

video.name: Spicy Vegan Tortilla Soup
video.description: Spicy Vegan Tortilla Soup. This is not your typical tex-mex, cumin and chili powder seasoned soup. The broth for this soup is simmered with epazote, chile morita, tomato, onion, garlic, and chipotle.

recipeIngredient: 8  Corn tortillas (cut into ½ in. strips)
(12 oz.) or 1 block Extra firm tofu, pressed, cut into ½ inch cubes
1 cup Diced tomates, canned, fire roasted
1 tsp. Soy sauce or braggs liquid aminos ((see notes))

recipeInstructions.text: Place the tofu and tortilla strips on a sheet tray lined with parchment paper. Bake for approximately 20 min. or until the tortillas are crispy and the tofu is slightly browned. Remove from oven and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the tofu and tortilla strips on a sheet tray lined with parchment paper. Bake for approximately 20 min. or until the tortillas are crispy and the tofu is slightly browned. Remove from oven and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In the meantime, bring water to a boil in a small pot and add whole tomatoes. Reduce heat and gently simmer for 3-4 min., or until tomatoes are soft and the skin begin to fall off them. Set tomatoes aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In the meantime, bring water to a boil in a small pot and add whole tomatoes. Reduce heat and gently simmer for 3-4 min., or until tomatoes are soft and the skin begin to fall off them. Set tomatoes aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a blender, puree cooked tomatoes, onion, chile morita, chipotle chiles, 2 ½ cups of HOT vegetable stock, tomato puree, garlic, and soy sauce until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: In a blender, puree cooked tomatoes, onion, chile morita, chipotle chiles, 2 ½ cups of HOT vegetable stock, tomato puree, garlic, and soy sauce until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large pot to medium heat and add the tomato-chile puree to it. Let it simmer for 1-2 minutes, until it slightly thickens and changes color. Add the rest of the vegetable stock, epazote spring, and baked tofu to the pot and bring to a simmer. Let simmer for 15 min. and season to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a large pot to medium heat and add the tomato-chile puree to it. Let it simmer for 1-2 minutes, until it slightly thickens and changes color. Add the rest of the vegetable stock, epazote spring, and baked tofu to the pot and bring to a simmer. Let simmer for 15 min. and season to taste.

itemListElement.text: Toast the pasilla chile on a comal or saute pan set to medium heat, until crispy but not burnt. Cut into strips
itemListElement.name: Toast the pasilla chile on a comal or saute pan set to medium heat, until crispy but not burnt. Cut into strips

itemListElement.text: Remove epazote sprig from pot, and serve soup in bowls.
itemListElement.name: Remove epazote sprig from pot, and serve soup in bowls.

itemListElement.text: Serve soup with assorted garnishes (baked tortilla strips, avocado, almond crema, toasted chile pasilla, and limes).
itemListElement.name: Serve soup with assorted garnishes (baked tortilla strips, avocado, almond crema, toasted chile pasilla, and limes).
